p: We measure the probability for long low-wind periods during which a high amount of energy is required from storage devices and backup power plants. Therefore, we identify all periods for which the wind power generation is continuously smaller than average (i.e. R( t) < 〈 R〉) and record their duration τ. We decided to choose 〈 R〉 as threshold value because we are interested in long periods of underproduction, which cause the storage to become depleted such that backup energy is required. From the single durations τ, we can estimate a probability distribution. Extreme events are quantified by the 95% quantile of the distribution.
